translations: v.使讨厌（disincline 的过去分词）

phrs.translation: 不愿的, 不愿意的, 不喜的, 无意于

sentences.sentence: He was disinclined to talk about himself, especially to his students.
sentences.translation: 他不愿谈论自己，尤其是对他的学生们。

sentences.sentence: He was strongly disinclined to believe anything that she said.
sentences.translation: 她说什么他都坚决不肯相信。

sentences.sentence: This means, when confronted by an entitled team member, an ethical leader is significantly disinclined to accommodate their demands.
sentences.translation: 这意味着，面对一位争取权益的团队成员时，一位有道德的领导者明显不愿意满足他们的要求。
